articles.title: Summit Attendees Plan to Commit to Take in More Migrants - The New York Times
articles.description: A joint declaration from the U.S. and Latin American countries is expected to be issued Friday to address surging migration rates that have affected the region.
articles.content: Venezuelan migrants received food at a bus station in Medellin in 2020. Colombia is offering protected status and work permits to nearly two million Venezuelans.Credit...Federico Rios for The New Yor… [+4476 chars]

articles.title: US Capitol riot panel warns conspiracy behind violence 'not over' - Philstar.com
articles.description: The conspiracy that drove a mob to attack the US Capitol in January 2021 still poses a threat to American democracy, the head of the congressional committee tasked with investigating the deadly riot will warn Thursday at the panel's first public hearing.

articles.author: Oliver Darcy, CNN Business
articles.title: Judge dismisses sexual assault lawsuit against former 'Good Morning America' boss Michael Corn - CNN
articles.description: A New York State judge on Wednesday dismissed a lawsuit filed last year against Michael Corn, the former "Good Morning America" boss who was accused of sexual assault in a case that rocked ABC News and left staffers up in arms.

articles.title: Exclusive: CEOs call on Senate to pass gun legislation - Axios
articles.description: It's the latest example of Corporate America delving into an issue where solutions often break down along partisan lines.
articles.content:
CEOs of more than 220 U.S. companies on Thursday will release a letter calling on the Senate to "take immediate action" to reduce gun violence, Axios has learned exclusively.
